text:
Between 2.2.6 and 2.2.8, mod_ldap started returning corrupted entries from its cache when null values were present.  This patch fixes the problem.

<http://anders.kaseorg.com/pub/patches/httpd-2.2.x-broken-ldap-caching.patch>
creator: andersk@mit.edu

text:
Thanks for the patch.

Is the symptom that you fail to see later attributes when an earlier one has a null value, or worse?  (for CHANGES purposes)
creator: covener@gmail.com

text: That’s right, it was losing later attributes after a null value.  It looks like it might also be possible for the 2.2.8 code to overflow the end and copy too many attributes, but I’m not sure.
creator: andersk@mit.edu
andersk@mit.edu
text: Closing since this is applied in 2.2.9; thanks.
